climbs.name: Ute Root
climbs.fa: Ed Strang or Luke Laeser, early 1990s

content.description: You are on your own on this one.  The first 40 feet is all overhanging, the first bolt is a good 20 feet of 5.12 up.  After the overhanging section are two overhangs that must be mantled, then steep slab climbing to the top. This is a project route, the rating is only what has been encountered so far. Post up with a pic if you get this one.
content.protection: There are 5 bolts and a two bolt anchor at the top. All bolts are new 5" long stainless.
content.location: This route is located by the first pullout in the East Creek area. The route is to the west of the largest tree in the parking area. Look for the painted bolts, the first one is way up there.

content.description: Fun route, the crux is only 20 feet off the ground but well protected.  The crux involves technical sport moves then the rest of the climb is more bouldery. The first move to get off the ground may be difficult for shorter people.
content.protection: The route has 5 bolts and a three bolt anchor at the top in a slot. All bolts are new 5" long, 3/8" dia. stainless with stainless hangers. As of 8/1/2006 the anchor has no chains to equalize.
content.location: This route is located off of the second and largest pullout on the right after the BLM sign. This pullout has a very large and tall cottonwood tree in the middle of it.  Cross the creek (usually dry by mid summer) and continue to the wall, the route is east of the cottonwood in the parking lot. Look for the painted bolts in a short but wide arete about 15 feet up.

content.description: Any number of easy 5th class will get you to the large, right-facing dihedral.  Chimney and face climb to a small roof.  Climb the overhanging offwidth to the top.
content.protection: Offwidth size pieces.  Tricams could help protect some pockets on the face.  No anchors at the top, belay from boulders and rap down from tree with slings ~70' left.
content.location:
~50' right of

5.10 offwidth

, in the next large, right-facing dihedral.

content.description: This is a fun OW out a roof. The crux comes at the lip. Use the foot rail to establish yourself in the roof. After the roof, it is easy climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: #6, a few small finger pieces and a hand-sized piece for the start.
content.location: This is 100 yards to the right of Silence is Golden, the left-arching crack near the East Creek Day Use Area.

content.description: Climb fingers to tight hands until you reach a dirty ledge with Mormon Tea bushes.  Scramble to an overhung pod where you can gain a good fist crack.  The crack narrows from fists back to fingers before the anchors.
content.protection: Doubles from fingers to fists.  Two bolt anchor with slings.  There is a tree with slings ~30' right of the anchors on top of the cliff as well.
content.location: Traveling west from the day use area this climb is on the south side of the road just before you exit the canyon and begin climbing up toward Cactus Park.  The crack ascends the middle of a slabby buttress, left of a large, left-facing dihedral by 50' or so.

content.description:
This route starts at the same place as

5.8

.  Trend right with easy climbing to the large, left-facing dihedral.  Stem and layback the offwidth corner to the top.
content.protection: Offwidth-size pieces plus a couple of fist-size.  There is no anchor at the top, belay from boulders on top.  Rap down off of tree with slings ~20' to the left.
